meanings.definition: To transfer back to a previous place or owner.
meanings.sent1: She is retransferring the book to the library.
meanings.sent2: After borrowing it, she is retransferring the book to her friend.
meanings.sent3: He kept retransferring the toy car between his hands, pretending it was a real car.
meanings.sent4: The memories kept retransferring in her mind, making her feel nostalgic.
meanings.sent5: The data retransferring from the external hard drive was taking longer than expected.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring something back to its original location or recipient.
meanings.sent1: The retransferring of the package was done carefully to avoid any damage.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the retransferring of the painting to the museum's collection.
meanings.sent3: The retransferring of the lost keys turned into a funny scavenger hunt.
meanings.sent4: The retransferring of power from one leader to another was a smooth transition.
meanings.sent5: The retransferring of the stolen goods was a relief to the store owner.
